basic Authentication :
--------------------------
NOTE: The stringData field for a Secret does not work well with server-side apply.


we can use the below formats to create any key and value:(ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configmap-secret/managing-secret-using-kubectl/#use-raw-data)
-----------
kubectl create secret generic db-user-pass \
    --from-literal=username=admin \
    --from-literal=password='S!B\*d$zDsb='
------------

ansible@debian:~/Desktop/weirdblackant/k8s/manifests/ref_secrets$ cat .basic_auth
username: calico
password: passwordcalico

ansible@debian:~/Desktop/weirdblackant/k8s/manifests/ref_secrets$ kubectl create  secret generic basicauth1 --from-file=.basic_auth --output=yaml --namespace=ts --dry-run=client
apiVersion: v1
data:
  .basic_auth: dXNlcm5hbWU6IGNhbGljbwpwYXNzd29yZDogcGFzc3dvcmRjYWxpY28K
kind: Secret
metadata:
  creationTimestamp: null
  name: basicauth1
  namespace: ts



method-2:
---------

echo -n 'admin' > ./username.txt
echo -n 'S!B\*d$zDsb=' > ./password.txt



kubectl create secret generic db-user-pass \
--from-file=./username.txt \
--from-file=./password.txt \
--output=yaml \
--dry-run=client \
--namespace=ts

method- 3:
---------
giving the keys to the values

kubectl create secret generic db-user-pass \
--from-file=username=./username.txt \
--from-file=password=./password.txt \
--dry-run=client \
--output=yaml \
--namespace=ts
